column5: LONDON  Aug 12 (IFR) - HSBC has named Philip Noblet as co-head of UK banking within its global banking and markets division  replacing Natalie Blyth  who will move to the lender's commercial banking arm as global head of large corporates.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-ITG to pay record fine for 'dark pool' violations
column5: Aug 12 Brokerage firm Investment Technology Group agreed to pay $20.3 million to settle charges it ran a secret trading desk that profited off of confidential customer information within its "dark pool " the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Wednesday.

column4: Ex-Perella Weinberg banker's father pleads guilty to insider trading
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 12 The father of a former investment banker at Perella Weinberg Partners pleaded guilty on Wednesday to a charge that he illegally traded securities ahead of healthcare mergers based on information supplied by his son.

column4: EU mergers and takeovers (Aug 12)
column5: BRUSSELS  Aug 12 The following are mergers under review by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EU merger process:

column4: Macy's cuts full-year sales forecast  forms China venture
column5: Macy's Inc  lowered its full-year sales forecast and said it formed an ecommerce joint venture in China to sell products on Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd's  Tmall marketplace as the department store operator looks to grow beyond the sluggish U.S. market. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Macy's cuts full-year sales forecast  forms China venture
column5: * Macy's expects $50 mln in sales from China in 2016   (Adds comments from CEO  analyst; updates shares)

column4: Macy's to set up China online store on Alibaba's Tmall Global
column5: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  said it signed an agreement with the Chinese joint venture of Macy's Inc  to set up the U.S. retailer's store on its online marketplace  Tmall Global.

column4: UPDATE 1-Macy's to set up China online store on Alibaba's Tmall Global
column5: Aug 12 Alibaba Group Holding Ltd said it signed an agreement with the Chinese joint venture of Macy's Inc to set up the U.S. retailer's store on its online marketplace  Tmall Global.

column4: Macy's to set up China online store on Alibaba's Tmall Global
column5: Aug 12 Alibaba Group Holding Ltd said it had signed an agreement with the Chinese joint venture of Macy's Inc to set up the U.S. retailer's online store on its online marketplace  Tmall Global.

column4: Macy's reports fall in sales  forms e-commerce JV in China
column5: Aug 12 Macy's Inc reported a 2.6 percent fall in quarterly sales  the fourth drop in six quarters  as spending by foreign tourists declined "significantly" due to a strong dollar.

column4: McDonald's Japan slides to first half loss as food scandals weigh
column5: TOKYO The Japan unit of McDonald's Corp's  said it slid deep into losses in the first six months of the year  as customers stayed away after a string of safety scandals and the fast-food chain booked store closure and other restructuring costs.

column4: McDonald's Japan slides to H1 loss as food scandals weigh
column5: TOKYO  Aug 12 The Japan unit of McDonald's Corp's said it slid deep into losses in the first six months of the year  as customers stayed away after a string of safety scandals and the fast-food chain booked store closure and other restructuring costs.

column4: Brazil fertilizer sales expected to fall in 2015 -Mosaic
column5: SAO PAULO  Aug 12 Fertilizer sales in Brazil will likely be between 30 million and 31 million tonnes in 2015  down from 32.2 million tonnes in 2014 due to market uncertainty  the head of U.S. fertilizer company Mosaic Co in Brazil  Floris Bielders  said on Wednesday.

column4: Monte Paschi cuts Nomura exposure to within regulatory levels
column5: ROME  Aug 12 Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena  has cut its exposure to Japanese bank Nomura  to within regulatory limits as required by the European Central Bank  the Italian lender said on Wednesday.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Israel's Orange 2nd-quarter profit slides 80 pct
column5: JERUSALEM  Aug 12 Partner Communications Co Ltd   Israel's second-largest mobile phone operator which operates under the Orange brand name  has reported an 80 percent drop in quarterly profit  citing intense competition.

column4: Israel's Orange 2nd-quarter profit slides 80 pct
column5: JERUSALEM  Aug 12 Partner Communications Co Ltd   Israel's second-largest mobile phone operator which operates under the Orange brand name  has reported an 80 percent drop in quarterly profit  citing intense competition.

column4: Agnelli family lifts stake in The Economist as Pearson sells out
column5: LONDON Britain's Pearson brought an end to its near 60-year ownership of The Economist on Wednesday  agreeing to sell its 50 percent stake in a deal that makes Italy's Agnelli family the largest shareholder in the weekly title. | Video

column4: Exor ups stake in The Economist to 43.4 pct for 287 mln pounds
column5: MILAN  Aug 12 Exor  the holding company of Italy's Agnelli family  has increased its stake in The Economist Group to 43.4 percent  from 4.7 percent by buying shares from Britain's Pearson  for 287 million pounds ($447 million).

column4: Pearson to sell Economist stake for 469 mln stg
column5: LONDON  Aug 12 Britain's Pearson  fresh from agreeing the sale of the Financial Times newspaper to Japan's Nikkei  said on Wednesday it would sell its 50 percent stake in the Economist Group for 469 million pounds ($730.6 million) to its existing investors.

column4: QGEP says Brazil Manati field holds 13.5 bln cubic meters of gas
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Aug 12 Queiroz Galvão Exploração e Produção SA said on Wednesday that the Manati offshore oil field in Brazil holds 13.5 billion cubic meters (477 billion cubic feet) of proven and probable  or "P2"  natural gas reserves.

column4: Plaintiffs' attorneys to get $67 mln in Pfizer securities deal
column5: A Manhattan federal judge has awarded plaintiffs' attorneys in a securities class action against drugmaker Pfizer Inc over off-label marketing more than $67 million in fees and expenses from a $400 million settlement reached in January.

column4: RBS hands out $5.2 million in 'role-based' pay awards
column5: LONDON  Aug 12 State-backed Royal Bank of Scotland has awarded shares worth more than 3.3 million pounds ($5.2 million) to 10 executives under new "role-based" pay awards it brought in to avoid limits on annual bonuses.

column4: Canada's NDP would look at emissions in deciding on pipelines
column5: OTTAWA  Aug 12 Canada's New Democratic Party would take greenhouse gas emissions into account in deciding whether projects like TransCanada Corp's Energy East pipeline should be allowed to proceed  NDP leader Thomas Mulcair said on Wednesday.

column4: Britain's FTSE dragged lower by miners and Unilever
column5: LONDON  Aug 12 Britain's top share index was dragged lower on Wednesday by Unilever and mining companies after the fall in the value of China's currency pulled down metals prices.

column4: Britain's FTSE dragged lower by miners and Unilever
column5: LONDON  Aug 12 Britain's top share index was dragged lower on Wednesday by Unilever and by mining companies after China's devaluation of the yuan pulled down metals prices.

column4: Britain's FTSE dragged lower by miners and Unilever
column5: LONDON  Aug 12 Britain's top share index was dragged lower on Wednesday by Unilever  hit after a broker downgrade  and by mining companies suffering from a slump in metal prices due to China's devaluation of the yuan.

column4: UPDATE 1-Fidelity Contrafund bullish on banks  singles out Wells Fargo
column5: BOSTON  Aug 12 Fidelity Contrafund manager Will Danoff  who oversees $113 billion in assets  said Wells Fargo & Co's profits "could benefit materially" from a rise in interest U.S. rates  and that he believed the stock market was underestimating the Federal Reserve's changing stance on rates.

column4: MOVES-Wells Fargo executive vice president Michael Heid to retire
column5: Aug 12 Wells Fargo & Co said Michael Heid  executive vice president and head of its home lending business  would retire and Franklin Codel would succeed him  effective Oct. 1.
